comment: Waited until the last week to post 80% of the workload, didn't communicate with students at all, we're a week from the last week of summer classes and he hasn't graded a thing. Slides are a garbled mess with repeated info throughout, quizzes consists of irrelevant info not covered in slides. Genuinely not sure how this guy is employed.

This has been one of the worst experiences I've had taking a class at this school. Professor was uncommunicative, late to grade, and late to upload crucial documents. Our exams and projects were uploaded multiple weeks after their posted date in the syllabus. Crucial slides and lecture videos were just mysteriously missing. Take anyone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Very disorganized. I dropped class because I had no idea what my grade would be. He was he made our test open at 6 PM on Saturday. He doesn't give any feedback. Short and unhelpful with emails when he does respond to emails, it's very unlikely that he will respond. Maybe he's better in person but online he gave up recording lecture videos. Terrible
Just take someone else

All of his dates are wrong. His annoucements are always wrong. Tests and quizzes are on Saturday with the test STARTING at 6PM. We asked him to open it earlier, he said no. Doesn't listen to students complaints and responds to emails very late. He is unneccesarily rude to students and multiple people complained in our gc.

Amazing professor. Operating systems is a tough course but the professor is very knowledgeable. 
Use C in his class if you want to impress him.
Tests are open note (and technically open book but you need the physical book). 
Quizzes are only open one day and he doesnt remind in class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This teacher is terrible at communicating. He didn't even know our own test date and kept confusing students. His videos are not good at explaining the material and it is extremely disorganized. HW was just confusing with little to no guidance or help when asked. Never given enough time to complete tasks.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment:
The right class listing doesn't show but it is CS4524: Cloud Computing

Out of 900 points 500 were from the tests while the rest were from the quizzes, assignments, and projects. Everything was online and pretty straightforward both coding and general complexity. Accessible outside of class to help and very knowledgeable overall regarding CS.
Exams are straight forward. Tests are based off slides and textbook. Professor is willing to help you understand. Nice person.

Awesome Professor, for this class the best choice. This class is cut and dry and Professor explains well. He is more than willing to help you understands. Review days are awesome. What is on study guide is on exam no tricks. Slides and quizzes help for exam prep!

The instructor assumes prior knowledge, assigns Windows-only projects, expects C knowledge w/out teaching it, and is disorganized in grading, quizzes, & material coverage. He takes a week to respond to emails and quizzes are only available on Sundays. Test questions & answers do not match information taught in class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Operating Systems. Read the textbook a lot as most answers are from there. Tests and quizzes are open book and notes. Start on Hw early because OS has some really complicated parts which you can't slack off on. Lectures are mostly  PowerPoint but he'll explain in detail if you ask questions. Overall, hard class but worth taking with this teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Garcia is a good professor and was very knowledgable when it came to Operating Systems, but I think an issue people might have is that the class is very cut and dry which can put people off. He lectures directly off the slides and his exams are pretty straight forward so make sure you really look over his study guides.

Super nice guy knows a ton about the subject. If you take him you'll learn a lot and I think its worth the experience but the class is not easy. He is a bit disorganized and gets assignments out somewhat late but he is getting better about that. Would highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The content of the class is hard to keep up with and the professor reads from a lot of slides. Assignments, Tests, and Projects were really hard so you have to make sure you're on top of it. He does allow you to print out as many notes as you can for the test so use this to your advantage.

Professor Garcia is awesome, I was nervous going into Operating Systems but the Professor has a very clear cut approach to everything. Assignments are based off the book. Quizzes as well. Exams are based of the quizzes. Very straightforward. No curveballs. Would take for any other class for sure.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This was the most unorganized class I've ever taken, from K-12 thru my junior year here. He didn't know the material before starting the class. There was like a month and a half gap in the middle of the semester where we didn't get any assignments, no quizzes, tests, nothing, and nothing was graded; the syllabus was not followed at all.

Almost everyone got a C or failed the class. We all have a theory that he curved down. Tried to contact him about it. Ignored email. Whole class was a mess. Learned nothing. All the smart kids barely made it out with a C. He assigns two textbooks. Expects you to read the entire book in record time. His lectures are hard to follow.

In order to get a B, I had to sell my soul. I am not joking. Everyone failed this class. His tests are open note but, he creates his own questions, are completely wrong, refuses to fix and then, everyone failed every test. His quizzes are basically tests. Whole class felt like we were cracked out on LSD waiting for the glory days to prosper. Run.

I might be the only person that got an A. Do not let me getting an A fool you. Run far as hell away. You'll walk in clueless. You'll walk out wanting to drop out. You can't take notes. He hates PowerPoints. He thinks he's Leonardo in the flesh. Him being nice is bait so you feel bad to not report him to the dept. Mind games man. Mind. Games.

Everyone failed the class. Refused to curved. He's nice but, enjoys causing sheer pain to students. Everyone failed the quizzes and he decided to make those weigh more in the class. His lectures make you want to Humpty-Dumpty off a ledge. This isn't a joke. This is real. Run far away. Take Sarah North. She's an angel compared to this guy.

Syllabus wasn't followed. Class was harder than it had to be. Got this guy a day or so before the class started. Decided to make everyone in the class pay for it. He has no idea as to what he's doing. Graded everything on the last day. Didn't know grades until 11:50am (due @ 12pm) on the last day. Doesn't respond to any emails. Refuses to curve.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: No clear idea as to what he was teaching. Stated on the first day, "I don't really know how any of this works.. We'll learn together". Proceeds to give us hard tests, a new book and graded assignments harshly. No extra credit was applied despite stating he would. Class was borderline impossible because of this guy. Don't take him for this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The professor was assigned the class a week~ before it started. This left him woefully unprepared, resulting in a much more difficult class. Many of his lectures were confused and didn't add much towards our understanding. Online resources and the book saved my grade.

Garcia was an okay professor. Although his lectures are somewhat uninspired and bland, it's clear that he understands the material and he's great at answering questions. He's also a very generous grader and the overall grading criteria was very reasonable. Would definitely recommend him if you want a fair and caring professor.

Randomly got handed the course. Turned the class from an easy one to a painfully difficult one. Focuses way too much on theory that is irrelevant. Class is a total mess. His writing on the board looks reminds me of a toddler playing with crayons against dry-wall. Still haven't gotten back anything graded. Simply refuses. Stay clear. You won't pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a good teacher. He had just started teaching when I took him to Computer Architecture and Design. He reads stuff out of the PowerPoint. His tests are passable and he is eager to help you out, just don't act like you don't care about him and he will help you out.

The class was 'supposed' to have 5 HW, 5 quizzes and 3 tests. Prof Garcia essentially graded everything the day before final grades were due. Therefore, I went into most of the tests/quizzes blind as the homework had not been graded. There were other issues I had, but that was the biggest one. Hopefully he'll improve as he gains experience.

There were many issues but in essence: his lectures & assignments were very unorganized and he's slow to provide feedback. However, his lectures got better later in the semester and he always listened to student feedback, making the class quite easy. Great guy, he might be a better professor in the future but as of now, there's room for improvement
